Demo - Postman 101

@getpostman

Requests

Postman Is An API Platform

Where you can make requests to existing APIs and immedately be able to see and save the details of each response, working like our browsers, but for APIs.

Edit Name

Name Your Requests

Postman allows you to name your requests, providing a clear, human readable description of what each API request does, helping make each API request easy to find.

Verb

Set The HTTP Verb

Defining the HTTP verb, allowing you to define GET, POST, and other common verbs that are used to perform different actions.

Path

Define Path To API

Set the host and path for each API request, defining the address being called with each API request being made via Postman.

Parameters

Manage Query Parameters

Define what the query parameters are for an API, defining the keys value pairs that shouold be passed in with each API request.

Authentication

Apply Authentication

You are able to apply a variety of common authentication methods to each API request, accomodating the many different ways we secure APIs.

Headers

Define Headers

Crafting exactly the HTTP headers you need to get exactly the type of API request you need, providing full control over each individual request.

Body

Control the Body

Having full control over defining the body that is sent along with each request, posting data in a variety of formats to each API as part of a request.

Send

Send Request

Having full control over defining the body that is sent along with each request, posting data in a variety of formats to each API as part of a request.

Response

See The Response

View the API request response details in a machine readable way, allowing you to see the details of each response in its raw format, prettied up.

Formats

See As Different Formats

You can choose to see the response in a variety of formats, allowing for the data to be displayed in whatever way you want as a consumer.

Save

Save Response

Then you can save response as an example, or locally to your local file system, giving you control over the data that is returned from an API request.

Save

Save Request

Each individual response can be saved, allowing it to be used in the future, shared, and made available to anyone who is given access, making use of each request.

Collections

Save As Collections

You can choose to see the response in a variety of formats, allowing for the data to be displayed in whatever way you want as a consumer.

Workspaces

Save Across Workspaces

Organize your collections across different workspaces, helping keep your API requests organized in a meaningful way that allows them to be put to use.


Download Postman Today!!

@getpostman
